title: Create a pod with an nginx container exposed on port 80. Add a busybox init container which downloads a page using 'echo "Test" > /work-dir/index.html'. Make a volume of type emptyDir and mount it in both containers. For the nginx container, mount it on "/usr/share/nginx/html" and for the initcontainer, mount it on "/work-dir". When done, get the IP of the created pod and create a busybox pod and run "wget -O- IP"
description: Create a pod with an nginx container exposed on port 80. Add a busybox init container which downloads a page using 'echo "Test" > /work-dir/index.html'. Make a volume of type emptyDir and mount it in both containers. For the nginx container, mount it on "/usr/share/nginx/html" and for the initcontainer, mount it on "/work-dir". When done, get the IP of the created pod and create a busybox pod and run "wget -O- IP"

steps: 4. kubectl run box-test --image=busybox --restart=Never -it --rm -- /bin/sh -c "wget -O- $(kubectl get pod box -o jsonpath='{.status.podIP}')"
